body.name: Dr. Brown's Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+Wide-Neck Baby Bottle, 5 oz/150 mL, Level 1 Nipple, 1-Pack, 0m+
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 21 hrs 40 mins
features: ANTI-COLIC BABY BOTTLE. Anti-Colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Decreases spit-up, burping and gas.
CONSISTENT FLOW RATE. Vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so babies can feed at their own pace.
PRESERVES NUTRIENTS. The anti-colic vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep.
BREASTFEEDING BOTTLE. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again.

BOTTLE GROWS WITH BABY. Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ baby bottle works best with the internal vent system in place but can be removed as baby’s feeding develops – no need to introduce a different bottle.
SUSTAINABLE BABY BOTTLE. Dr. Brown’s Wide-Neck bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable.

PLASTIC BANK COLLABORATION. Dr. Brown’s has collaborated with Plastic Bank to prevent ocean plastic and reduce their plastic footprint. Purchasing Dr. Brown’s baby bottles help toward their commitment to prevent 31 million plastic bottles from entering the ocean annually. Learn more at PlasticBank.com.
DISHWASHER SAFE. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free.
Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ Wide-Neck Baby Bottle 5 oz/150 mL, with Level 1 Slow Flow Nipple, 1 Pack, 0m+
body.description: Your options have never been better with Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow® Anti-Colic Options+™ Wide-Neck Baby Bottle. The anti-colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Dr. Brown’s® bottles provide a more comfortable feeding experience for baby by decreasing spit-up, burping and gas. This vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s® silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so baby can feed at their own pace. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again. Dr. Brown’s vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep. The silicone nipple, together with the internal vent system, offer a reliable and trusted bottle feeding experience that makes Dr. Brown’s the #1 Pediatrician Recommended Baby Bottle in the U.S.* Made to grow with baby, our bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with Playtex nipples!!
reviews.reviewText: Baby only does good on wide neck nipplesThese are the only bottles that work with Playtex wide neck bottle nipples.She loves only the Playtex brand nipples and I despise the vent aire bottles with the screw on vented bottoms annoying to clean and u can't make ahead of time to keep in fridge. Hey will leak. And u can't hear in a bottle warmer.. But that's what I've had to use with her since she was about 2 weeks old So I've been using the Playtex bottle with drop in liners since the fulls size nipple fits both type of Playtex bottles.She has stomach issues and has to use the liquid ready to feed alimentum gross stuffWe have to heat her bottles to room temp at least. The liquid formula has to be kept refrigerated. It's terrible to travel with lolIf I use the vent aire it will leak, if I use the bagged bottles they are hard to heat while out. Can't make bottles to put in fridge for the night feedings or u have to pour them into something else to heat then back in the bottle with bag.Why my baby gotta be so picky 😭Not even kidding I have every major bottle. Brand out here. Standard nipple to wide. I've spent a few hundred on bottles trying to get her to take a diff typeThen I came across a comment that said Playtex nipples would fit in Dr browns options wide neck 🙌 thank u Jesus!So we travel with this type and I can make a bottle up for the fridge and heat it in the same bottle when she's ready to eat.I know this post is long and may not help one other person lol but just incase there's someone's googling for days what bottle ring will fit Playtex nipple here u go! Thankful for that one person's comment on another site for this info.* The regular dr browns wide neck bottle that has the blue air tube will not work with Playtex nipples. I ordered both because she didn't specify which wide neck those nipples worked with. Has to be the options plus with the green tube thing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE this bottle!I wanted to get these before I gave birth but ended up going with another brand. When my son was born, he tried several different brands of bottles (Avent, MAM, etc). He didn’t like any of them. I ordered this one, and he took to it right away! The nipple is pretty soft, and it’s a larger size (probably feels more like a nipple does when he breastfeeds so he likes it). It also is anti-colic, which is great because it takes out all the air bubbles. My son would eat very quickly and get lots of gas in his tummy, and it would hurt him. It stopped once he started drinking from this bottle.Overall, 100% recommend! But Dr. Brown bottles form the start, you won’t regret it :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bottle, very similar to usual Dr. Brown's
reviews.reviewText: I got this bottle when my 4-month old had forgotten how to use a bottle and I have compared it to the narrower Dr. Brown bottles and Mam bottles. I tried the Mam bottles, thinking their vent system must compare to the Dr. Brown bottles, but I hated them. Their vent system only worked when the bottle had a bit of a vacuum already, so the nipple kept collapsing, making my son stop eating to let air come in through the nipple tip. In comparison to the usual Dr. Brown bottles, there are pros and cons. Both have excellent venting systems, are not too hard to clean, and only occasionally leak a little. The wide bottle does not connect to my medela breast milk pump, which detracts from it's claim of being designed with breastfeeding in mind. More milk can pool in the edge of the wider bottle and even the nipple (pictured), so you have to tip it vertical to get all of the milk out at the end of the feed. However, with the narrower Dr. Brown bottle nipples, my son's lip ends up on the nipple ring (pictured) instead of entirely on the nipple. He doesn't seem to mind, but I think that would be uncomfortable. I want an adapter for the wide nipple with the narrower bottle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars best bottle when nursing
reviews.reviewText: this is the only bottle my baby will take! and it doesn’t cause nipple confusion

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars 2 out 10 bottles leak. Buyer beware.
reviews.reviewText: 2 out 10 bottles that we bought leak. Even though our baby doesn't even drink more than 4 ounces of formula, some of the bottles still leak from where the "screw ring" screws on to the bottle base. Which is odd because you would think that they would have a better quality control at the factory where they manufacture these bottles... but it is what it is I guess... it seems like the old school bottles were made of better quality than this new plastic stuff. I guess it's true what they say: "They don't make them like they used to."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The only bottle my little one would take!! Love it..
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this bottle because I had my baby 2 months ago and I am currently breastfeeding but for the times where I'm out and about and not able to do so conveniently I had a bottle to use. My son does have a little tongue tie and this is a bottle he took to easily because it represents the closest to breastfeeding and we absolutely love this. Would definitely recommend to have their moms.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very hard to remove the cap
reviews.reviewText: Not sure if it is normal for this wide type nipple Dr. Brown bottles, but mine is very hard to open/remove the cap. Never have the problem with my 4 OZ narrow ones

reviews.reviewTitle: Llego muy bien y es de muy buena calidad, gracias
reviews.reviewText: Me lo recomendaron para hacer transición de pecho a biberon solo espero que este me sirva

Buen producto, hasta el momento me ha sido de mucha utilidad, vi que algunos mencionaban que la tetina era demaciado flexible y se aplastaba por la presión, asi mismo, que tiraba leche por ese problema.En mi caso no me ha pasado, la tetina es normal, ni muy flexible ni muy dura, no se aplasta cunado mi bebe la usa.Me llego con un cepillo pequeño para limpiar las piezas del interior que es bastante útil y se agradece.Dr. Brown siempre es una marca de confianza, no me ha decepcionado

Me encanta por la función anti cólicos que fue muy notoria en nuestro bebé. Buena calidad, el único pero es que si se voltea, definitivamente se sale la leche. Si lo ponen en la pañalera deben ponerle la tapa blanca que viene para que no se caiga además de ponerle bien la tapa. La verdad es que lavarlas no es tan difícil como mucha gente dice.

La marca Dr Brown ya lo había usado anteriormente con mi primer niño hace 3 años pero había estado usando otras marcas con mi bb actual con el tipo breastmilk como la marca comotomo y tommee tippee pero ambas me decepcionaron ya que se derrama la leche por las válvulas de aire o por el cierre del biberón que se hicieron para evitar los cólicos. Así que me puse a investigar y me entere que Dr Brown ya había sacado este estilo de biberones y la verdad que no se derrama por los lados únicamente por la tetina pero ¿que biberón no se derrama por ahí? por más que indique que no, después de haber pasado por varios biberones todos se derraman por la tetina incluso la marca avent.Así que la verdad este biberon cumple con mis expectativas tiene el mejor sistema de anticoliquitos.
